intro: Linnaea floribunda, commonly known as the twinflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its small, fragrant, white flowers that typically appear in pairs on slender stems. The plant is native to the northern regions of North America and parts of Eurasia, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Linnaea floribunda is known for its early spring blooming and is often found in forest understories.
